update.description:
I updated ArrangePlugin.cc to listen on a topic, specified by the <topic_name> tag in SDF. If the specified topic publishes a GzString message that matches one of the arrangement names specified in SDF, the plugin sets the world to the corresponding arrangement.

There is a very simple example in examples/stand_alone/arrange which shows the functionality of this pull request by cycling through all of the possible arrangements in the world file arrange_test.world. You can build and run it as follows:

```
#!bash
cd <gazebo_root>/examples/stand_alone/arrange
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
gazebo ../arrange_test.world
./arrange_plugin_test
```

This pull request is required to complete the Haptix tasks I'm working this week.
update.title: ArrangePlugin: Transport library support

content.raw: Can the `&` be restored? I'm guessing this is also a remnant of prior changes.
content.html: Can the & be restored? I'm guessing this is also a remnant of prior changes.

content.raw: I like the stand_alone program. It's fun!
content.html: I like the stand_alone program. It's fun!

update.title: ArrangePlugin: Transport library support

content.raw: Agreed. You can replace `/gazebo/arat` with `~`, which will prepend `/gazebo/<world_name>` to the topic name.
content.html: Agreed. You can replace /gazebo/arat with ~, which will prepend /gazebo/<world_name> to the topic name.

update.description:
I updated ArrangePlugin.cc to listen on a topic, specified by the <topic_name> tag in SDF. If the specified topic publishes a GzString message that matches one of the arrangement names specified in SDF, the plugin sets the world to the corresponding arrangement.

There is a very simple example in examples/stand_alone/arrange which shows the functionality of this pull request by cycling through all of the possible arrangements in the world file arrange_test.world. You can build and run it as follows:

update.title: ArrangePlugin: Transport library support

content.raw: Typically we use topic names like `/gazebo/<world name>/` as a prefix for topics. @nkoenig should we do something similar here?
content.html: Typically we use topic names like /gazebo/<world name>/ as a prefix for topics. @nkoenig should we do something similar here?

content.raw: agreed; this is something I switched around when I was experimenting with setting the argument to a GzString msg and promptly forgot to switch it back...
content.html: agreed; this is something I switched around when I was experimenting with setting the argument to a GzString msg and promptly forgot to switch it back...

content.raw: We usually put a leading `_` to denote function arguments.
content.html: We usually put a leading _ to denote function arguments.

content.raw: Why does this need to change? I think const references are good for string arguments.
content.html: Why does this need to change? I think const references are good for string arguments.

update.description:
I updated ArrangePlugin.cc to listen on a topic, specified by the <topic_name> tag in SDF. If the topic publishes a string message that matches one of the existing arrangement names, the plugin switches to that arrangement.

There is a very simple example in examples/stand_alone/arrange which shows the functionality of this pull request by cycling through all of the possible arrangements in the world file arrange_test.world. You can build and run it as follows:

```
#!bash

mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
gazebo ../arrange_test.world
./arrange_plugin_test
```

This pull request is required to complete the Haptix tasks I'm working this week.
